revised_title: A Description of Basalt Stones in Nassau, Treves, and Colen
tldr: The author, Abraham Trembly, describes his observations of basalt stones in the countries of Nassau, Treves, and Colen. He notes their hexagonal shapes, formation as prisms, and their use in buildings and pavements. He also mentions their similarity to the stones found in Ireland's Giants-Causey and their presence along the Rhine river. The author encourages further research and study of these natural curiosities.
